model.name: inputType
model.title: Input Type
model.description: Set the expected data type of the input message. If the actual message type is different at runtime, camel look for a required Transformer and apply if exists. If validate attribute is true then camel applies Validator as well. Type name consists of two parts, 'scheme' and 'name' connected with ':'. For Java type 'name' is a fully qualified class name. For example {code java:java.lang.String} , {code json:ABCOrder} . It's also possible to specify only scheme part, so that it works like a wildcard. If only 'xml' is specified, all the XML message matches. It's handy to add only one transformer/validator for all the transformation from/to XML.
model.label: configuration

validate.description: Whether if validation is required for this input type.

id.description: Sets the id of this node

description.description: Sets the description of this node
